subject: Psychology
title: Reciprocity and Social Norms
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Reciprocity and Social Norms.

hook.text: A coworker buys you coffee. Now you feel compelled to buy theirs tomorrow. The debt is automatic and powerful.

buildup.text: The reciprocity norm says we should return favors. It's one of the most universal rules across human cultures.

discovery.text: Gouldner argued reciprocity is the glue of social life ‚Äî it creates ongoing cycles of exchange and trust.

twist.text: Manipulators exploit reciprocity: give a small gift, then ask for a large favor. The obligation is hard to resist.

climax.text: Reciprocity built civilization. It also makes us vulnerable to influence tactics. The same norm enables and exploits.

punchline.text: A small gift creates a big obligation. That's how reciprocity works.

quiz.question: What is the reciprocity norm?
options: The social rule that we should return favors
A law requiring equal pay for equal work
The tendency to avoid helping anyone
